title: Daily Momentum Picks

stocks.name: Palantir Technologies
stocks.thesis:
**PLTR — High Conviction**

AI powerhouse riding the enterprise adoption wave. Up 149% in 2025, with Q3 revenue hitting $1.18B and US commercial sales surging 121% YoY. The company raised full-year guidance to $4.4B, signaling strong pipeline visibility. Government contracts provide stable base while commercial acceleration drives upside.

**Trade:** Enter on pullback to $70-72 (20 SMA zone). Target $90. Stop $65.

**Risk:** Valuation stretched at 180x P/E - any growth deceleration could trigger sharp correction.

stocks.name: NVIDIA Corporation
stocks.thesis:
**NVDA — High Conviction**

The undisputed AI infrastructure king. Barclays calls it a top large-cap pick for 2026, noting 'AI is still the place to be.' Data center demand remains insatiable with cloud hyperscalers racing to build out capacity. Blackwell architecture ramp provides multi-quarter tailwind.

**Trade:** Accumulate on any dip to $135-138 support. Target $165. Stop $128.

**Risk:** China export restrictions and hyperscaler capex moderation could pressure growth rates.

stocks.name: Lam Research
stocks.thesis:
**LRCX — Medium-High Conviction**

Semiconductor equipment leader up 68% since August. With SMH up 49% in 2025, the semi cycle remains strong. Critical supplier for advanced chip manufacturing, benefiting from AI-driven capacity expansion. More reasonable valuation than pure-play AI names.

**Trade:** Entry zone $75-78. Target $92. Stop $70.

**Risk:** Semi cycles are notoriously volatile - inventory corrections could emerge in H2.

stocks.name: Micron Technology
stocks.thesis:
**MU — Medium Conviction**

Memory chip leader riding the AI infrastructure wave. Q1 FY2026 beat expectations with strong HBM (high-bandwidth memory) guidance. Datacenter demand for AI accelerating. The 993% EPS growth reflects the cycle turning favorable after deep trough.

**Trade:** Entry on pullback to $95-98. Target $120. Stop $88.

**Risk:** Memory pricing cycles brutal - any demand softening could trigger 20-30% correction.

stocks.name: Amazon.com Inc
stocks.thesis:
**AMZN — High Conviction**

RBC Capital's favorite idea for 2026, citing 'best-in-class visibility on AI infrastructure ROIC with compelling product cycle.' AWS remains the profit engine, while retail margins expand. Bedrock AI platform gaining enterprise traction.

**Trade:** Accumulate at current levels or on dips to $220. Target $260. Stop $205.

**Risk:** Antitrust headwinds and e-commerce competition from Temu/Shein.

market_summary: Markets continue their upward trajectory into 2026, driven by AI infrastructure buildout and strong corporate earnings. The semiconductor sector (SMH +49% in 2025) leads the charge, with chip equipment makers and memory suppliers benefiting from insatiable datacenter demand. Barclays analysts note 'AI is still the place to be' and expect a 'choppy but cheerful year for chips.' Key risks include stretched valuations in AI names and potential Fed rate path uncertainty.
